thread.title: Shoop on Gray: He's today's style of safety
thread.title_full: Shoop on Gray: He's today's style of safety

title: Shoop on Gray: He's today's style of safety
text:
Shoop on Gray: He's today's style of safety Bob Shoop on Maleik Gray: He's today's style of safety Slot to Tennessee Links 
Tennessee officially added the second in-state signee of its 2017 class moments ago here on National Signing Day, when LaVerge standout and Under Armour All-American Maleik Gray inked his scholarship papers with the Vols. 
“He has the positional versatility in the back-end that we talk about,” second-year UT defensive coordinator Bob Shoop said on UT’s broadcast. “Maleik, like these other guys we’ve talked about (Solon Page, Cheyenne Labruzza , Terrell Bailey ) look like shooting guards or small forwards in the NBA. They’re long, athletic and it’s the body type that’s had success in the SEC.” 
(What's next for the Vols? Make sure you're in the loop — take five seconds to sign up for our FREE Vols newsletter now!) A longtime Vols commit who resisted Florida State’s unending advances till the end, Gray has long been a star in the Volunteer State and likewise long known Shoop. 
“I’ve known Maleik a long, long time from a previous institution,” Shoop told Mike Keith. “To me, this is the key: keeping the top players in the state and playing in Neyland Stadium. 
“He’s today’s style of safety. He can play the run like a linebacker, defend the pass like a corner, he can hit … He has played at a high level of competition, played in the Under Armour All-Star game. Very glad to have Maleik part of our family. He chose to stay at home and be a Vol.” Author
